[[File:Lída Holubová - Rath Dinen.jpg|thumb|right|''Rath Dinen'' by [[Lída Holubová]]]]
'''Rath Dínen''' was the street through the [[Hallows]] of [[Minas Tirith]], where the great of [[Gondor]], Kings and Stewards alike, were laid after death. It was accessed through the gate of [[Fen Hollen]] in the rear wall of the sixth level of the city.<ref name=Siege>{{RK|Siege}}</ref>

The Street was lined with images of those who lay there. The [[Stewards of Gondor|Stewards]] had a House apart from the tombs of the Kings, the [[House of the Stewards]], where [[Denethor]] perished in {{TA|3019}}.<ref>{{RK|Pyre}}</ref>

When the seedling of the [[White Tree of Gondor|White Tree]] was found on the slopes of Mindolluin by [[Gandalf]], the [[Dead Tree]] that had stood in the courts of Minas Tirith was laid in Rath Dínen.<ref>{{RK|Steward}}</ref>

After [[Meriadoc Brandybuck]] and [[Peregrin Took]] died of old age in [[Gondor]] they were laid to rest in Rath Dínen.<ref name="Later">{{App|Later}}</ref>

In {{FoA|120}}<ref name="Later"/> when [[Aragorn|King Elessar]] felt the oncoming of death he went to Rath Dínen and laid himself down in the House of the Kings.  It was there that he bade farewell to [[Arwen]].<ref>{{App|Tale}}</ref>

==Etymology==
''Rath Dínen'' is a [[Sindarin]] name. It means "Silent Street".<ref name=Siege/> It is a compound of ''[[rath]]'' ("street (in a city)") and ''[[tîn|tínen]]'' ("silent").<ref>{{HM|UI}}, p. 551</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Silent Street.jpg|thumb|250px|left|The Silent Street in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''2015: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Named "the Silent Street", Rath Dínen is inaccessible in the pre-battle version of Minas Tirith. During the [[battle of the Pelennor Fields]] [[Beregond]] throws the [[Fen Hollen]] open but is followed by the members of "the Withered Tree" conspiracy seeking to overthrow the rule of the Stewards. The players have to battle the Withered Tree within the Silent Street in a group instance before witnessing the end of [[Denethor]]. In the after-battle version of Minas Tirith, the Silent Street is opened for the mourning.
